description:
doc/install: add openbsd

Add openbsd to the $GOOS list.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

Can we drop the two new "On OpenBSD" paragraphs?
I tried not to explain how to use every operating
system: instead I assume that OpenBSD and FreeBSD and
non-Debian/Ubuntu users will already know how to do
those things or be able to adapt the Debian/Ubuntu
instructions.

In practice it does seem to be the case that if you're
running OpenBSD, you know what you're doing.  :-)

Russ

Sure, we can add this information to the Wiki instead. PTAL.

On 13 November 2011 04:28, Russ Cox <rsc@golang.org> wrote:

> Can we drop the two new "On OpenBSD" paragraphs?
> I tried not to explain how to use every operating
> system: instead I assume that OpenBSD and FreeBSD and
> non-Debian/Ubuntu users will already know how to do
> those things or be able to adapt the Debian/Ubuntu
> instructions.
>
> In practice it does seem to be the case that if you're
> running OpenBSD, you know what you're doing.  :-)
>
> Russ
>

On 2011/11/13 16:42:05, r wrote:
> looks good but you need to update the change description (hg change)

Thanks, fixed. PTAL.

http://codereview.appspot.com/4964053/diff/9001/doc/install.html File doc/install.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/4964053/diff/9001/doc/install.html#newcode115 doc/install.html:115:

delete this paragraph split and put both sentences into the same paren set.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=623fffdae2ed ***

doc/install: add openbsd

Add openbsd to the $GOOS list.

R=golang-dev, r, rsc
CC=golang-dev
